Name: Painted jar
Description: Roughly cylindrical pottery jar, with gently convex profile, and red-painted decoration imitating the string net in which such a vase might be transported. This is a standard storage vessel in the late fourth millennium BC, found in ceramic and in stone. This example was found in the rich cemeteries at Tarkhan, dating to the period of the earliest recorded unification of Egypt, about 3000 BC.
